intro: Jussiaea suffruticosa var. octofila, commonly known as the coastal bottlebrush, is a shrub native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, cylindrical clusters of bright red flowers that bloom throughout the year, attracting various pollinators. The plant has woody stems and small,革质 (leathery) leaves that are adapted to withstand salt spray and strong coastal winds. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dune environments. Its unique appearance and ecological resilience make it a notable species in coastal botany.
